properties.areaDesc: North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 2:07PM PST until January 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
...EXTENDED PERIOD OF WINTER WEATHER CONTINUES...

.Numerous cold, wet weather systems will continue to push through
the area over the next several days. Colder air is expected to
arrive with each sequential wave, thus snow levels will steadily
lower through the weekend. Many winter weather headlines have been
extended out though Monday, or have been expanded to cover more
area. Winter weather will continue into the middle of next week.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9
inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County and North Central and
Southeast Siskiyou County, including Mount Shasta City,
Dunsmuir, McCloud, Medicine Lake, Interstate 5, and Highway 89.

* WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to 10 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Blowing
snow may lower visibilities at times.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.

* Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and
limited visibilities.

* See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions.

* A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow
will cause travel difficulties.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY
